It is a word puzzle, Marilyn.
This week's puzzle is called Big Mo.
Every answer is a word or name in which the second syllable is an accented Mo.
For example, if I said absorption process, you would say osmosis.
Number one is love or hate.
Number two is a Japanese robe.
In the south - in the - in Polynesia, an island in Polynesia.
And it's also the name of a Girl Scout cookie.
How about a stuffed Indian pastry?
I think I know that one.
How about a cocktail often served at brunch?
How about a prestigious college in Claremont, Calif.?
I have a friend who went there.
And your last one is a chip dip made with avocados.
Marilyn, you were really good at that.
